title: Definitions
context: PART III. EXPORTS: FLOWERS AND FOLIAGE §147-31 Definitions. For the purposes of this part, unless otherwise required by the context: &ldquo;Commercial exporter&rdquo; means any person who exports or causes to be exported from the State of Hawaii: (1) any fresh or processed flowers or foliage to a wholesaler or retailer for sale or resale or for distribution for commercial or promotional purposes, or (2) any fresh or processed flowers or foliage as a gift for subsequent sale or resale. &ldquo;Container&rdquo; means package used for the export shipment. &ldquo;Department&rdquo; means the department of agriculture. &ldquo;Export&rdquo; means shipment to any point outside the State. &ldquo;Flowers and foliage&rdquo; means cut flowers, foliage, and plants with roots attached. &ldquo;Method of packaging&rdquo; means the manner in which flowers are placed in the container and procedures used to insure retention of desirable qualities in the flowers and foliage. &ldquo;Packing material&rdquo; means anything used in packaging flowers or foliage for shipment other than the container. &ldquo;Person&rdquo; means any individual, firm, corporation, partnership, or association. [L 1959, c 267, pt of §2; am L Sp 1959 2d, c 1, §22; am L 1961, c 132, §2 and c 139, §1; am L 1963, c 193, §9; Supp, §22-26.2; HRS §147-31; am L 1977, c 20, §1] Revision Note Definitions rearranged. Cross References Importation of flowers and foliage, see §150A-5.
